04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: King Aegon I Targaryen took both of his sisters to wife. Rhaenys and Visenya were dragonriders, with the silver-gold hair, purple eyes, and beauty of true Targaryens. Elsewise, the two queens were as unlike each other as any two women could be…save in one other respect. Each of them gave the king a son.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: The wedding of King Aegon I Targaryen and his sister, Princess Rhaenys of House Targaryen was a grand affair, especially considering the Valyrian marriage customs. It was held in King's Landing over three days, with great feasts, famous knights competing in jousts and many people from across the Seven Kingdoms joining in the festivities. Many lords gave gifts of silver-gold to seal their loyalty to the new union whilst Queen Visenya took advantage of her renowned beauty and gave out garments dyed with purple – giving rise to true kings are unveiled unlike those before him.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Aenys came first. Born in 7 AC to Aegon’s younger wife, Rhaenys, the boy was small at birth and sickly. He cried all the time, and it was said that his limbs were spindly, his eyes small and watery, and that the king’s maesters feared for his survival. He would spit out the nipples of his wet nurse, and give suck only at his mother’s breasts, and rumors claimed that he screamed for a fortnight when he was weaned. So unlike King Aegon was he that a few even dared suggest that His Grace was not the boy’s true sire, that Aenys was some bastard born of one of Queen Rhaenys’s many handsome favorites, the son of a singer or a mummer or a mime. And the prince was slow to grow as well. Not until he was given the young dragon Quicksilver, a hatchling born that same year on Dragonstone, did Aenys Targaryen begin to thrive.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: The breaths were so tiny that it almost seemed as if Aenys, the first of King Aegon's sons and third born of His Grace and Queen Rhaenys, had never truly been born. But when he finally did cry, his parents feared that something was wrong with the small and sickly lad, so frail and spindly. Even the midwife suggested to give suck only watery, milk out of fear that she would not able to feed such a child. Yet despite all odds, Aenys thrived — luckily growing into a healthy young man unlike his bend brother Jaehaerys at home in Dragonstone who remained small and homely even though handsome.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Prince Aenys was three when his mother, Queen Rhaenys, and her dragon, Meraxes, were slain in Dorne. Her death left the boy prince inconsolable. He stopped eating, and even began to crawl as he had when he was one, as if he had forgotten how to walk. His father despaired of him, and rumors flew about the court that King Aegon might take another wife, as Rhaenys was dead and Visenya childless and perhaps barren. The king kept his own counsel on these matters, so no man could say what thoughts he might have entertained, but many great lords and noble knights appeared at court with their maiden daughters, each more comely than the last.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Prince Aenys had always been a bit lost in the shadows of his siblings, but when Queen Rhaenys and Meraxes were slain in Dorne,, even King Aegon feared for him. He stopped eating and appeared to be inconsolable, until suddenly he set off one day on his own accross Westeros. Everywhere he went it seemed people would comment on how comely the prince was for being so small and sickly as an infant; however unlike his beautiful sister Rhaena or handsome brother Aegon, Prince Aenys had never thrived. Though much to everyones's surprise, wherever this slender boy journeyed people filled with pitty spake his praises eagerly hoping that he would bring change against what they saw as unfornate legacy of Aegon's children - claiming if only he had been crowned none of this tragedy may have befallen them under the false impression that because Aenyas was not born by watery ooze...he might sway fate in their favor.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: All such speculation ended in 11 AC, when Queen Visenya suddenly announced that she was carrying the king’s child. A son, she proclaimed confidently, and so he proved to be. The prince came squalling into the world in 12 AC. No newborn was ever more robust than Maegor Targaryen, maesters and midwives agreed; his weight at birth was almost twice that of his elder brother.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: After speculation had ended, Queen Visenya announced that she was carrying a child of the King's and proclaimed confidently that a newborn would come squalling into the world soon. This news spread like wildfire amongst the kingdom and through her entourage, as word of her news travelled to Dorne and even across the narrow sea, to Tyrosh or perhaps Volantis. Everyone agreed that the unborn baby - if robust - twice-over blessed by both Old gods and The Drowned God would bring great joys in Westeros. Both Lannisters of Casterly Rock and people of King's Landing awaited with bated breath for news of this royal blessing.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The half-brothers were never close. Prince Aenys was the heir apparent, and King Aegon kept him close by his side. As the king moved about the realm from castle to castle, so did the prince. Prince Maegor remained with his mother, sitting by her side when she held court. Queen Visenya and King Aegon were oft apart in those years. When he was not on a royal progress, Aegon would return to King’s Landing and the Aegonfort, whilst Visenya and her son remained on Dragonstone. For this reason, lords and commons alike began to refer to Maegor as the Prince of Dragonstone.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Prince Aenys, the eldest of King Aegon and Queen Visenya Targaryen's sons, remained steadfast in Aegonfort as heir apparent when his royal progress took them to Dragonstone and King’s Landing. His half-brother Prince Maegor was often close by and yet not always amicable with him. Holding court on behalf of the king was a prominent duty for both princes, seeing off many vassals from Vhagar to Duskendale. The queen dowager had found refuge in Driftmark where she held many grand balls in honor of their brothers grandchildren that lived in Alys Harroway's House Velaryon within the Great Fork of the Blackwater. Their famous knights Ser Harys Horpe, Theo Bolling and Malcolm Blanetree were just some that came closer than others to serve House Targaryen during this time throughout this realm.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Queen Visenya put a sword into her son’s hand when he was three. Supposedly the first thing he did with the blade was butcher one of the castle cats, men said…though more like this tale was a calumny devised by his enemies many years later. That the prince took to swordplay at once cannot be denied, however. For his first master-at-arms his mother chose Ser Gawen Corbray, as deadly a knight as could be found in all the Seven Kingdoms.
events: butcher one of the castle cats
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Queen Visenya and Ser Gawen Corbray had arrived at the castle amidst the royal progress and remained in close proximity with King Aegon, Prince Aenys, and her half-brother Maegor. To the surprise of those present, Queen Visenya put forth a deadly plan that she had devised—to butcher one of the castle cats. She chose Ser Gawen as her accomplice and two took to carrying out the strange phrase—one they would all remember forever. Rollingford nearby fell into dismay; rumor of Her Grace's dark deeds spread all around House Tyrell, Lord Edwell Celtigar, The Vulture Kings domain where Vaella rules from Tully waterside and Quenton Qoherys can cross anytime. Even in distant corners like Osmund Strong’s King Harren stronghold in Lannisport or Larissa Velaryon court on Driftmark Isle far away news travelled quickly concerning Queen Visenya's deeds at Castle Aegonfort.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Prince Aenys was so oft in his sire’s company that his own instruction in the chivalric arts came largely from the knights of Aegon’s Kingsguard, and sometimes the king himself. The boy was diligent, his instructors agreed, and did not want for courage, but he lacked his sire’s size and strength, and was never more than adequate as a fighter, even when the king pressed Blackfyre into his hands, as he did from time to time. Aenys would not disgrace himself in battle, his tutors told one another, but no songs would ever be sung about his prowess.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Prince Aenys of House Targaryen, accompanied by four members of Aegon's Kingsguard, came to Aeogon's court in the castle. They were all known for their diligent courage and adequate service that had often been pressed upon them. After putting all other matters aside, Queen Viserney devised a plan with Ser Gawen Corbray in which they took Prince Aeneys away from the court and to Rollingford, a nearby place governed by House Tyrell. There they chose to butcher one of the castle cats as an offering to The Drowned God — something once done by Maegor Targaryen and Vaella during her tenure as the Vulture King.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Such gifts as this prince possessed lay elsewhere. Aenys was a fine singer himself, as it happened, with a strong sweet voice. He was courteous and charming, clever without being bookish. He made friends easily, and young girls seemed to dote on him, be they highborn or low. Aenys loved to ride as well. His father gave him coursers, palfreys, and destriers, but his favorite mount was his dragon, Quicksilver.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Prince Aenys came to Aegon's court as instructed, pressed by his oft diligent and courageous rule. He was possessed of a dote for the ride, often giving his fine steed strong sweet caresses and gentle pats on its neck. Quicksilver, too, earned the prince’s attention with his courteous and charming behavior that was accompanied by a cleverness that only a highborn low equine could own.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Prince Maegor rode as well, but showed no great love for horses, dogs, or any animal. When he was eight, a palfrey kicked him in the stables. Maegor stabbed the horse to death…and slashed half the face off the stableboy who came running at the beast’s screams. The Prince of Dragonstone had many companions through the years, but no true friends. He was a quarrelsome boy, quick to take offense, slow to forgive, fearsome in his wroth. His skill with weapons was unmatched, however. A squire at eight, he was unhorsing boys four and five years his elder in the lists by the time he was twelve, and battering seasoned men-at-arms into submission in the castle yard. On his thirteenth nameday in 25 AC, his mother, Queen Visenya, bestowed her own Valyrian steel blade, Dark Sister, upon him…half a year before his marriage.
events: slashed half the face off the stableboy
unhorsing boys four and five years his elder in the lists
battering seasoned men-at-arms into submission in castle yard
bestowed her own Valyrian steel blade, Dark Sister, upon him
adjectives: quick to take offense, slow to forgive, fearsome in his wroth
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Prince Maegor Targaryen rode in the castle yard on a fine strong sweet steed, proudly unhorsing boys four and five years his elder in the lists and battering seasoned men-at-arms into submission. His skill with weapons unmatched and his quick to take offense, slow to forgive demeanor made him a fearsome force across Westeros. He showed great love for animals, but when a stableboy failed to attend the prince's mount properly he kicked the stableboy in the stables and stabbed the horse to death instead of simply taking offense and forgiving as expected from so highborn of noble blood. He then slashed half the face off the stableboy, bestowing her own Valyrian steel blade, Dark Sister, upon him as an apology. Yet it was more signal than apology; no one would dare cross Prince Maegor now.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The tradition amongst the Targaryens had always been to marry kin to kin. Wedding brother to sister was thought to be ideal. Failing that, a girl might wed an uncle, a cousin, or a nephew, a boy a cousin, aunt, or niece. This practice went back to Old Valyria, where it was common amongst many of the ancient families, particularly those who bred and rode dragons. The blood of the dragon must remain pure, the wisdom went. Some of the sorcerer princes also took more than one wife when it pleased them, though this was less common than incestuous marriage. In Valyria before the Doom, wise men wrote, a thousand gods were honored, but none were feared, so few dared to speak against these customs.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: The Targaryens often married kin to kin and wed brother to sister, seeking power in the ancient and pure Valyrian blood that ran through their veins. When that failed, they would even take more than one wife, though such practices were seen as incestuous by the culture of the Seven Kingdoms. Ser Harys of the Kingsguard remembered his past king, Aegon I Targaryen and how he had bestowed her own Valyrian steel blade, Dark Sister upon prince Maegor Targaryen at Old Valyria for showing a fearsome prowess and skill with weapons unmatched since then. The old knight also found it hard to fathom how Maegor who seemed so quick to take offense was slow to forgive sometimes could seem like any other boy – kicking stableboys in stables or slashing half a face off one or stabbed a horse or unhorsing boys four an five times his elder in lists – yet all was forgiven due to his great love for animals -- if not foe then those very same boy later earned places among household knights Maegor had brought form Old Valyria when most their families came down with them too.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: This was not true in Westeros, where the power of the Faith went unquestioned. The old gods were still worshipped in the North and the Drowned God in the Iron Islands, but in the rest of the realm there was a single god with seven faces, and his voice upon this earth was the High Septon of Oldtown. And the doctrines of the Faith, handed down through centuries from Andalos itself, condemned the Valyrian marriage customs as practiced by the Targaryens. Incest was denounced as a vile sin, whether between father and daughter, mother and son, or brother and sister, and the fruits of such unions were considered abominations in the sight of gods and men. With hindsight, it can be seen that conflict between the Faith and House Targaryen was inevitable. Indeed, many amongst the Most Devout had expected the High Septon to speak out against Aegon and his sisters during the Conquest, and were most displeased when the Father of the Faithful instead counseled Lord Hightower against opposing the Dragon, and even blessed and anointed him at his second coronation.
verbs: expected the High Septon to speak out against Aegon and his sisters during the Conquest
counseled Lord Hightower against opposing the Dragon,
blessed and anointed him at his second coronation
adjectives: abominations in the sight of gods and men
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: In Westeros, the old gods were still worshipped and hand down through the centuries Valyrian marriage customs were considered an ancient, pure and noble thing. When Aegon I began his conquest many pious lords denounced the Targaryen's incestuous habits - taking more than one wife and marrying kin to kin - but Lord Hightower was counseled against opposing the dragon. The High Septon of Oldtown was expected to speak out against Aegon and his sisters but instead he blessed and anointed him at his second coronation. This act proved that incestuous marriage practices were considered true even in Andalos despite being abominations in sight of gods and men.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Familiarity is the father of acceptance, it is said. The High Septon who had crowned Aegon the Conqueror remained the Shepherd of the Faithful until his death in 11 AC, by which time the realm had grown accustomed to the notion of a king with two queens, who were both wives and sisters. King Aegon always took care to honor the Faith, confirming its traditional rights and privileges, exempting its wealth and property from taxation, and affirming that septons, septas, and other servants of the Seven accused of wrongdoing could only be tried by the Faith’s own courts.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: The High Septon had grown accustomed to the Valyrian marriage customs, and although he didn't necessarily agree that Aegon should marry both of his sisters, Rhaenys and Visenya, at the same time he remained compliant in honoring them. In order to show respect for the Faith, Aegon exempted those of Westeros who worshipped the old gods from coronation rites and affirming some nobles familiarity with traditional ceremonies. Once crowned Aegon the Conqueror, known true in Andalos as well as across Seven Kingdoms, the High Septon considered it a vile sin in sight of gods and men; yet still blessed and anointed him at his second coronation.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The accord between the Faith and the Iron Throne continued all through the reign of Aegon I. From 11 AC to 37 AC, six High Septons wore the crystal crown; His Grace remained on good terms with each of them, calling at the Starry Sept each time he came to Oldtown. Yet the question of incestuous marriage remained, simmering below the courtesies like poison. Whilst the High Septons of King Aegon’s reign never spoke out against the king’s marriage to his sisters, neither did they declare it to be lawful. The humbler members of the Faith—village septons, holy sisters, begging brothers, Poor Fellows—still believed it sinful for brother to lie with sister, or for a man to take two wives.
events: accord between the Faith and the Iron Throne
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Aegon I, His Grace the King and High Septons were relieved to have finally granted the accord between the Faith and the Iron Throne. While Aegon had grown accustomed to remaining behind courtesies like poison, simmering below, he still took care to honor the familiar traditional exemptions by affirming all of House Tyrell across Rollingford's behalf. As tribute His Grace had called upon his High Holiness The Seven, residing in Oldtown's Starry Sept, who believed that this may have been inevitable. However many of those present disagreed feeling that while familiarity was established some things just can't continue forever - not even with a Targaryen King alive.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Aegon the Conqueror had fathered no daughters, however, so these matters did not come to a head at once. The sons of the Dragon had no sisters to marry, so each of them was forced to seek elsewhere for a bride.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Aegon the Conqueror father no daughters, but he did seek to continue the ancient accord between the Faith and the Iron Throne which had been simmering below courtesies like poison for generations. In order to put an end to this, the Dragon himself onboarded Ser Harys from House Tyrell, Septon Pater from Rollingford and Princess Deria from Oldtown - all with their own agendas. Aegon went as far as calling on Lord Father of Starry Sept at High Holiness of Stonedance by inviting even Lord Buckwell and his kin of Drowned God who lived in Bywater. Even Lords Tully and Qoherys could not be forgotten along with Larissa Velaryon, the Vulture King's niece, Vaella when discussing matters related to the continued unresolved quarrel.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Prince Aenys was the first to marry. In 22 AC, he wed the Lady Alyssa, the maiden daughter of the Lord of the Tides, Aethan Velaryon, King Aegon’s lord admiral and master of ships. She was fifteen, the same age as the prince, and shared his silvery hair and purple eyes as well, for the Velaryons were an ancient family descended from Valyrian stock. King Aegon’s own mother had been a Velaryon, so the marriage was reckoned one of cousin to cousin.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Prince Aenys and Lady Alyssa were wed in a ceremony at Tides, steeped in ancient Valyrian marriage customs. Amidst the silvery waves of the sea and purple hues of evening light, Allard Royce his betrothed Jeyne Westerling, a feast laid out by Lord of the Tides himself and witnessed by King Aegon himself, Prince Aethan Velaryon, Alyn Tarbeck and other noble lords. Reckoned a maiden fit for ancient Valyrian wedding rites shared between some of royalty’s most revered houses Targaryen and Velaryon; making her brother, Arya Stark's cousin with whom she was often mischievous as a child very proud.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: It soon proved both happy and fruitful. The following year, Alyssa gave birth to a daughter. Prince Aenys named her Rhaena, in honor of his mother. Like her father, the girl was small at birth, but unlike him she proved to be a happy, healthy child, with lively lilac eyes and hair that shone like beaten silver. It was written that King Aegon himself wept the first time his granddaughter was placed in his arms, and thereafter doted upon the child…mayhaps in some part because she reminded him of his lost queen, Rhaenys, in whose memory she had been named.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Lady Alyssa and Prince Aenys were wed in the Tides by a Lord of the Tides as per ancient Valyrian marriage customs. Nine moons after their wedding, Lady Alyssa proved to befertile and gave birth to a small, healthy girl they named Rhaena who had lilac coloured eyes and silver hair. King Aegon wept when he saw his newest grandchild; He doted on her greatly, happy to witness new life blossoming in his kingdom. The court rejoiced along with the royal family on this happy occassion but none more than Princess Alyssa for it seemed she had at last found purpose in life through motherhood.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: As the glad tidings of Rhaena’s birth spread across the land, the realm rejoiced…save, perhaps, for Queen Visenya. Prince Aenys was the unquestioned heir to the Iron Throne, all agreed, but now an issue arose as to whether Prince Maegor remained second in the line of succession, or should be considered to have fallen to third behind the newborn princess. Queen Visenya proposed to settle the matter by betrothing the infant Rhaena to Maegor, who had just turned eleven. Aenys and Alyssa spoke against the match, however…and when word reached the Starry Sept, the High Septon sent a raven, warning the king that such a marriage would not be looked upon with favor by the Faith. His High Holiness proposed a different bride for Maegor: his own niece, Ceryse Hightower, maiden daughter to the Lord of Oldtown, Manfred Hightower (not to be confused with his grandsire of the same name). King Aegon, mindful of the advantages of closer ties with Oldtown and its ruling house, saw wisdom in the choice and agreed to the match.
events: issue as to whether Prince Maegor remains second in the line of succession
proposed betrothing the infant Rhaena to Maegor
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: The glad tidings of Aenys' daughter, Rhaena's birth spread quickly and soon reached all throughout the Seven Kingdoms. Even before Rhaena was named, the issue as to whether Prince Maegor remains second in the line of succession was raised by House Tyrell who felt entruiged by her small yet healthy lilac eyes that proved she had taken after her mother, Visenya Targaryen. The prospect of betrothing the infant to Maegor uncertainly stirred up a commotion but King Aegon listened to Ceryse Hightower and Manfred Hightower who spoke against it and agreed that Rhaena should be unquestioned heir in line for Iron Throne while Maegor receives an additional lands and titles from Oldtown and other outlying regions as consolation. When sent a raven warning the king of any such ambitions among his court, Aegon rejoiced knowing that Rhaena would remain unfettered despite Lord Father's desire for a Valyrian marriage customs for their son and reluctancy to agree on proposed betrothing with Poxy Jeyne Poore.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Thus it came to pass that in 25 AC, Maegor Targaryen, Prince of Dragonstone, wed Lady Ceryse Hightower in the Starry Sept of Oldtown, with the High Septon himself performing the nuptials. Maegor was thirteen, the bride ten years his senior…but the lords who bore witness to the bedding all agreed that the prince made a lusty husband, and Maegor himself boasted that he had consummated the marriage a dozen times that night. “I made a son for House Targaryen last night,” he proclaimed as he broke fast.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: At the Starry Sept of Oldtown, a lusty dozen were present to bear witness as Lord Maegor Targaryen and Lady Ceryse Hightower wed. It was on that same night that they consummated the marriage, much to the delight of the High Septon who had come expressly for performing such sacred rites. At once proclaiming them husband and wife, he then sent a raven across the Seven Kingdoms with glad tidings of such news. Though rumors of House Tyrell's disdain for this union had been reaching out from Highgarden before long, nothing could stop Queen Visenya from rejoicing in her son taking his first steps into adulthood - one unquestioned heir greater than before!

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The son came the next year…but the boy, named Aegon after his grandsire, was born to Lady Alyssa and fathered by Prince Aenys. Once again, celebrations swept the Seven Kingdoms. The little prince was robust and fierce and had “a warrior’s look about him,” declared his grandsire, Aegon the Dragon himself. While many still debated whether Prince Maegor or his niece, Rhaena, should have precedence in the order of succession, it seemed beyond question that Aegon would follow his father, Aenys, just as Aenys would follow Aegon.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: As the son of Maegor Targaryen and Lady Ceryse Hightower, Aegon was born in the Seven Kingdoms and swept away by his father shortly after they had bedding ceremonies before the High Septon in Starry Sept of Oldtown. Upon hearing this news, people debated what would follow but little did they know that the robust and fierce warrior’s blood ran through Aegon’s veins as Maegor fathered him with a Lannister from Casterly Rock. The acclaim for Prince Aenys, Princess Alys and Rhaena now paled at Aegon's entrance into the world, some even began to refer to him as Aegon the Dragon - how foreboding!

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: In the years that followed, other children came one after the other to House Targaryen…to the delight of King Aegon, if not necessarily that of Queen Visenya. In 29 AC, Prince Aegon acquired a baby brother when Alyssa gave Prince Aenys a second son, Viserys. In 34 AC, she gave birth to Jaehaerys, her fourth child and third son. In 36 AC came another daughter, Alysanne.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: King Aegon and Queen Visenya of House Targaryen had two sons, Prince Aegon and Alyssa. Soon after the birth of their children, news swept through the Seven Kingdoms debating who should follow next in line to become the leader. King Aegon would soon be one of many rulers that fathered robust and fierce warriors who roamed from land to land across Westeros. Much joy came from other kingdoms when Queen Visenya's delightful little ones came into this world. Queen Visenya set aside time for each prince and princess as they grew up which included her daughter, Alysanne and three more princes: Prince Viserys, Jaehaerys, and Aenys. As time passed on it was clear who will follow after King Aegon - his robust son with a warrior’s spirit that would conquer nations like his father before him - Prince Maegor Targaryen.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Princess Rhaena was thirteen when her little sister was born, but Grand Maester Gawen observed that “the girl delighted so in the babe that one might think she was the mother herself.” The eldest daughter of Aenys and Alyssa was a shy, dreamy child, who seemed to be more comfortable with animals than other children. As a little girl, she often hid behind her mother’s skirt or clung to her father’s leg in the presence of strangers…but she loved to feed the castle cats, and always had a puppy or two in the bed. Though her mother provided her with a succession of suitable companions, the daughters of lords great and small, Rhaena never seemed to warm to any of them, preferring the company of a book.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Prince Aenys, Princess Rhaena, and Grand Maester Gawen observed the whimsical laughter of their aunt, Queen Alyssa, from the castle balcony with delight. Whenever one of her little children hid behind a chair or clung to her skirts for love, she would feed them sweets and provided comforting words as a mother should. Though shy at first, Rhaena eventually joined in on the delightful little group that included Prince Aegon and his siblings when Lady Ceryse Hightower of House Tyrell came to town from Rollingford with servants in tow. The dreamy princess had gone past her usual melancholic state; she even giggled once or twice like all the other children who joined their family reunion. In response to this unexpected joy, those present beheld in silent awe these moments where familial bonds were restored and strengthened before their eyes.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: At the age of nine, however, Rhaena was presented with a hatchling from the pits of Dragonstone, and she and the young dragon she named Dreamfyre bonded instantly. With her dragon beside her, the princess slowly began to grow out of her shyness; at the age of twelve she took to the skies for the first time, and thereafter, though she remained a quiet girl, no one dared to call her timid. Not long after, Rhaena made her first true friend in the person of her cousin Larissa Velaryon. For a time the two girls were inseparable…until Larissa was suddenly recalled to Driftmark to be wed to the second son of the Evenstar of Tarth. The young are nothing if not resilient, however, and the princess soon found a new companion in the Hand’s daughter, Samantha Stokeworth.
events: presented with a hatchling from the pits of Dragonstone, bonded instantly
took to the skies for the first time, Larissa was suddenly recalled to Driftmark to be wed
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Princess Rhaena was presented with a hatchling from the pits of Dragonstone, and it bonded instantly with her. With every moment that passed, her shyness faded away as she grew more resilient in their bond. It was named Dreamfyre and took to the skies for the first time; however, Larissa Velaryon of evenstar of Tarth and Samantha Stokeworth's lives at home in Driftmark were suddenly recalled when they were expected to wed according to Valyrian marriage customs. Rhaena could only observe from afar with

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: It was Princess Rhaena, legend says, who put a dragon’s egg in Princess Alysanne’s cradle, just as she had for Prince Jaehaerys two years earlier. If those tales be true, from those eggs came the dragons Silverwing and Vermithor, whose names would be writ so large in the annals of the years to come.
events: put a dragon's egg in Princess Alysanne's cradle
names would be writ so large in the annals of the years to come
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Princess Rhaena, Alysanne, and Jaehaerys Targaryen had just put a dragon's egg in Princess Alysanne's cradle. The legends said their names would be writ so large in the annals of years to come that it echoed throughout every court from Westeros to Indeed, across the Freeholds of Valyria even down to Andalos. As news spread throughout Westeros of the legendary Targaryen progeny presented with a hatchling from Dragonstone—bonded instantly and taking flight for the first time—Larissa Velaryon was suddenly recalled to Driftmark by House Tyrell to be wed. Despite her shyness and timidity on the ground she found an inner resilience while soaring through heavens with Dreamfyre; running away was never an option as her fate would intertwined with theirs forever more.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Princess Rhaena’s love for her siblings, and the realm’s joy at each new Targaryen princeling, was not shared by Prince Maegor or his mother, Queen Visenya, for each new son born to Aenys pushed Maegor farther down in the line of succession, and there were still those who claimed he stood behind Aenys’s daughters too. And all the while Maegor himself remained childless, for Lady Ceryse did not quicken in the years that followed their marriage.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: The news of Princess Rhaena and Prince Maegor's love spread far and wide all over the Seven Kingdoms, creating a joyful atmosphere when, despite being childless, they remained devoted to each other. Even Queen Visenya and Aenys' daughters, Lady Ceryse - renowned for her piety - celebrated heartily. Little did they know however that their names would be writ so large in the annals of the years to come with a legendary tale of dragon eggs placed in cradles throughout Westeros by members of House Targaryen.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: On tourney ground and battlefield, however, Prince Maegor’s accomplishments far exceeded those of his brother. In the great tourney at Riverrun in 28 AC, Maegor unhorsed three knights of the Kingsguard in successive tilts before falling to the eventual champion. In the melee, no man could stand before him. Afterward he was knighted on the field by his father, who dubbed him with no less a blade than Blackfyre. At ten-and-six, Maegor became the youngest knight in the Seven Kingdoms.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Prince Maegor felt uneasy as he watched the competition in Riverrun's tourney and melee. His eyes narrowed as his Kingsguard was unhorsed, and soon a young knight from House Blackfyre had been dubbed victorious. As the cheers of the crowd filled his uncle's castle, he thought of what lay ahead for him back in King's Landing. With his aunt, Dowager Queen Visenya Targaryen there to keep an eye on him and her son Prince Aegon leading Aenys' daughters in piousness - all would be more joyous if he could find love there like had shared with Lady Ceryse of House Hightower before she was pushed away due to their childless relationship. He remained hopeful that someday someone would fill the void left by Ceryse and bring back gladness into his life.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Other feats followed. In 29 AC and again in 30 AC, Maegor accompanied Osmund Strong and Aethan Velaryon to the Stepstones to root out the Lysene pirate king Sargoso Saan, and fought in several bloody affrays, showing himself to be both fearless and deadly. In 31 AC, he hunted down and slew a notorious robber knight in the riverlands, the so-called Giant of the Trident.
events: rooting out the Lysene pirate king Sargoso Saan
hunted down and slew a notorious robber knight in the riverlands
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Prince Maegor, having distinguished himself at the tourney and melee at Riverrun, now confidently followed Osmund Strong and his close companions Aethan Velaryon and Sargoso Saan into the Stepstones as part of a mission to root out the Lysene pirate king. He accompanied them fearlessly as they hunted down notorious robber knights in the Riverlands, wielding his Valyrian steel sword Dreadflame with deadly precision and effectiveness. With him rode The Giant of the Trident, a towering figure from Westeros who was said to have done fell deeds during Aegon I’s conquest centuries ago. Together they fought against anyone who dared oppose them, striking terror into their enemies' hearts wherever they went and earning themselves renown throughout all Seven Kingdoms.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Maegor was not yet a dragonrider, however. Though a dozen hatchlings had been born amidst the fires of Dragonstone in the later years of Aegon’s reign, and were offered to the prince, he refused them all. When his young niece Rhaena, in only her twelfth year, took to the sky astride Dreamfyre, Maegor’s failure became the talk of King’s Landing. Lady Alyssa teased him about it one day in court, wondering aloud whether “my good-brother is afraid of dragons.” Prince Maegor darkened in rage at the jape, then replied coolly that there was only one dragon worthy of him.
events: a dozen hatchlings born amidst the fires of Dragonstone
Rhaena took to the sky astride Dreamfyre
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Maegor, accompanied by Aethan Velaryon, arrived back home at Dragonstone with a dozen hatchlings born amidst the fires. They were followed by Aegon and Rhaena who had taken to the sky astride their dragon Dreamfyre. Lady Alyssa refused to be teased and replied that these young dragons would make Westeros tremble in awe of them one day. The Sons of the Vulture King spread fear as they set out to visit many places with Maegor leading them as they fought against lord Allard Royce's Four False Kings, rooted out the Lysene pirate king Sargoso Saan alongside House Tyrell and hunted down and slew a notorious robber knight in Andalos - Fearless and deadly in battle.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The last seven years of the reign of Aegon the Conqueror were peaceful ones. After the frustrations of his Dornish War, the king accepted the continued independence of Dorne, and flew to Sunspear on Balerion on the tenth anniversary of the peace accords to celebrate a “feast of friendship” with Deria Martell, the reigning Princess of Dorne. Prince Aenys accompanied him on Quicksilver; Maegor remained on Dragonstone. Aegon had made the seven kingdoms one with fire and blood, but after celebrating his sixtieth nameday in 33 AC, he turned instead to brick and mortar. Half of every year was still given over to a royal progress, but now it was Prince Aenys and his wife, Lady Alyssa, who journeyed from castle to castle, whilst the aging king remained at home, dividing his days between Dragonstone and King’s Landing.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Prince Aenys and Deria Martell, daughter of the Lord Father of Dorne, journeyed to Sunspear to celebrate the indepence of Dorne from the westermen and riverlords. Maegor Targaryen came to support them with an entourage fit for royalty, including Aegon the Conqueror himself. The entire court celebrated in peace away from King's Landing under the watchful eye of Aegon whom refused all teasing along his frustrations at being so far from home. From Dragonstone a dozen hatchlings had been born amidst flames while Rhaena took to sky holding her dreamfyre with Lady Alyssa by her side. Young as they were, their ambitions brought them closer together as surely as if everyone could sense a forthcoming destiny that would forever shape Westeros.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The fishing village where Aegon had first landed had grown into a sprawling, stinking city of a hundred thousand souls by that time; only Oldtown and Lannisport were larger. Yet in many ways King’s Landing was still little more than an army camp that had swollen to grotesque size: dirty, reeking, unplanned, impermanent. And the Aegonfort, which had spread halfway down Aegon’s High Hill by that time, was as ugly a castle as any in the Seven Kingdoms, a great confusion of wood and earth and brick that had long outgrown the old log palisades that were its only walls.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Aegon and his entourage of high lords landed in a fishing village, having grown swollen with many more wishing to join them on the journey. As they spread across Westeros, what had been some scattered and peaceful settlements before quickly became sprawling cities of great confusion. Everywhere were immense amounts of people as well as unplanned, impermanent structures that made the place stinking and dirty, reeking with a certain disorientation among its residents. As Aegon continued to High Hill from there, it was clear that their ambition for planned cities instead of these still flimsy and ugly ones was not only shared but expanding steadily.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: It was certainly no fit abode for a great king. In 35 AC, Aegon moved with all his court back to Dragonstone and gave orders that the Aegonfort be torn down, so that a new castle might be raised in its place. This time, he decreed, he would build in stone. To oversee the design and construction of the new castle, he named the King’s Hand, Lord Alyn Stokeworth (Ser Osmund Strong had died the previous year), and Queen Visenya. (A jape went about the court that King Aegon had given Visenya charge of building the Red Keep so he would not have to endure her presence on Dragonstone.)
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Aegon moved quickly, giving orders as he went. With Queen Visenya's help, he decreed the construction of a castle on Dragonstone in 35AC and named Lord Alyn Stokeworth to oversee its fit out. Ser Osmund Strong was chosen to complete the tasks and vermithor from the Red Keep, with great confusion and excitement erupting amongst Aegon's entourage. By doing so, it seemed that their ruler had begun his campaign for the Seven Kingdoms in earnest.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Aegon the Conqueror died of a stroke on Dragonstone in the 37th year After the Conquest. His grandsons Aegon and Viserys were with him at his death, in the Chamber of the Painted Table; the king was showing them the details of his conquests. Prince Maegor, in residence at Dragonstone at the time, spoke the eulogy as his father’s body was laid upon a funeral pyre in the castle yard. The king was clad in battle armor, his mailed hands folded over the hilt of Blackfyre. Since the days of Old Valyria, it had ever been the custom of House Targaryen to burn their dead, rather than consigning their remains to the ground. Vhagar supplied the flames to light the fire. Blackfyre was burned with the king, but retrieved by Maegor afterward, its blade darker but elsewise unharmed. No common fire can damage Valyrian steel.
events: was laid upon a funeral pyre
Blackfyre was burned with the king
adjectives: in residence at Dragonstone at the time
's mailed hands folded over the hilt of Blackfyre
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Viserys and Prince Maegor stood in the castle yard, watching as Aegon was laid upon a funeral pyre. Viserys spoke of how showing honor to a great king such as Aegon, who had moved to Dragonstone 37 years ago after the Conquest, decreeing that Lord Alyn Stokeworth should oversee all construction until it was fit for a ruling King, was more important than any ritual they could perform. Queen Visenya supplied all of the wood to be burned while Ser Osmund Strong retrieved Blackfyre and laid it across his chest with his mailed hands folded over the hilt and his blade darker but elsewise unharmed. As everyone watched on solemnly in silence, Lady Ceryse Hightower stepped forward with her son Allard Royce by her side and struck the pyre alight in accordance with Valyrian customs. The flames engulfed King Aegon and Blackfyre until nothing remained of them both but ashes.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The Dragon was survived by his sister Visenya; his sons, Aenys and Maegor; and five grandchildren. Prince Aenys was thirty years of age at his father’s death, Prince Maegor five-and-twenty.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Visenya and Aenys, the two surviving Dragon children of Maegor's father's death, were five-and-twenty and thirty years respectively. When news of their father's passing arrived at Dragonstone, Lord Hightower from House Tyrell was in residence and supplied vast amounts of resources for the funeral pyre ceremonies with Septon Pater from Rollingford traveling to retrieve Blackfyre for what would be Maegor’s ceremonial burning in The 37th Year After the Conquest. As his mailed hands folded under the hilt of Blackfyre and its blade darker but elsewise unharmed, a solemn quiet fell over Castle Yard as Viserys spoke words showing his respect for his brother’s legacy.  In that moment, people forgot their worries even if it were only fleeting; Lord Tyrell set forth plans to organize serval religious pilgrimages across Westeros with Princess Deria of Oldtown following closely behind him swearing support to those pious lords who joined on the journey.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Aenys had been at Highgarden on his progress when his father died, but Quicksilver returned him to Dragonstone for the funeral. Afterward he donned his father’s iron-and-ruby crown, and Grand Maester Gawen proclaimed him Aenys of House Targaryen, the First of His Name, King of the Andals and the Rhoynar and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, and Protector of the Realm. The lords who had come to Dragonstone to bid their king farewell knelt and bowed their heads. When Prince Maegor’s turn came, Aenys drew him back to his feet, kissed his cheek, and said, “Brother, you need never kneel to me again. We shall rule this realm together, you and I.” Then the king presented his father’s sword, Blackfyre, to his brother, saying, “You are more fit to bear this blade than me. Wield it in my service, and I shall be content.”
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: When King Aenys passed away, the entire realm mourned. A funeral with grandeur and respect was held at his beloved Highgarden. Maegor and Quicksilver, brothers of Aenys, donned the finest clothing they could find in their wardrobe while Gawen, a distant cousin of theirs from Dragonstone knelt before them to pay his respects. As a final tribute to their father's passing, the brothers drew forth twin swords made of iron-and-ruby which were crafted for him when he declared himself king five-and-twenty years ago. They then presented it to each other in solemnity and kissed it as a symbol of honor; this drew ancient Valyrian marriage customs back into memory among people of Westeros. The funeral was accompanied by pious lords from far and wide paying homage to the late King Aenys while servants presented them with offerings once they bowed or knelt before him. Amidst all this chaos, Dowager Queen Visenya watched quietly as her son Maegor proclaimed himself King after thirty years ruling as Prince of Dragonstone.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: (This bequest would prove to be most unwise, as later events would demonstrate. Since Queen Visenya had previously gifted her son with Dark Sister, Prince Maegor now possessed both of the ancestral Valyrian steel swords of House Targaryen. From this date forward, however, he would wield only Blackfyre, whilst Dark Sister hung on the walls of his chambers on Dragonstone.)
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: The Dowager Queen Visenya was ill at ease as she arrived in Dragonstone. Accompanied by her son the Prince Maegor and their entourage, the fortress of their House had become a home for death. Their mourning for her late father, Aenys, took on an added solemnity when it became time to perform the bequest; the gifting of his iron-and-ruby coronet to Maegor. Proving he possessed both the strength and wisdom to properly wield such power would not come unwisely what with all four False Kings lurking around Westeros later that year.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: After the funeral rites had been completed, the new king and his entourage sailed to King’s Landing, where the Iron Throne still stood amidst mounds of rubble and mud. The old Aegonfort had been torn down, and pits and tunnels pockmarked the hill where the cellars and foundations of the Red Keep were being dug, but the new castle had not yet begun to rise. Nonetheless, thousands came to cheer King Aenys as he claimed his father’s seat for his own.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: On their journey to King's Landing, Queen Visenya and Prince Maegor were accompanied by a huge entourage, including Ser Harys Velaryon, Septon Pater of House Tyrell, Lord Father Rollingford as well as some knights from the Kingsguard. As they arrived back to Dragonstone and completed the funeral rites of King Aengon I and sailed to King’s Landing, they saw that Iron Throne still stood. The old Aegonfort had been torn down; yet its ruins still pockmarked the city where Aenys claimed his father’s seat as the new king. Meanwhile, Lady Ceryse Hightower already assembled her household which included even Lucifer Massey among many famous knights of Westeros such as Warior's Sons Davos Baratheon or Ser Tyler Hill.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Thereafter His Grace set out for Oldtown to receive the blessing of the High Septon. Though he could have made the journey in a few short days on Quicksilver, Aenys preferred to travel by land, accompanied by three hundred mounted knights and their retinues. Queen Alyssa rode beside him, together with their three eldest children. Princess Rhaena was fourteen years of age, a beautiful young girl who stole the heart of every knight who saw her; Prince Aegon was eleven, Prince Viserys eight. (Their younger siblings, Jaehaerys and Alysanne, were deemed too young for such an arduous journey and remained on Dragonstone.) After setting out from King’s Landing, the king’s party made its way south to Storm’s End, then west across the Dornish Marches to Oldtown, guesting at each castle on the way. His return would be by way of Highgarden, Lannisport, and Riverrun, it was decreed.
events: receive the blessing of the High Septon
the king’s party make its way south to Storm’s End, then west across the Dornish Marches to Oldtown,
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: His Grace, Queen Alyssa and the royal entourage set out to receive the blessing of the High Septon at Oldtown. With his four eldest children, Aenys and Princess Rhaena leading Quicksilver on their fourteen year old Alysanne’s beautiful mare they traveled across the Dornish Marches and a few short days on Quicksilver's back passed through Highgarden, Storm's End and King's Landing. As they rode past The Red Keep pockmarked from years of warring fought to claim the Iron Throne still stood strong as a reminder of when Aenys first claimed it in place of his father Aegon I unfinished dreams. Finally arriving in Oldtown after an arduous journey, His Grace offered thanks for Lord Father Tyrell’s hospitality during their stay before returning home to Kings Landing seven moons later with his granddaughter Jeyne Westerling as is tradition amongst Valyrian marriage customs.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: All along the route the smallfolk appeared by the hundreds and thousands to hail their new king and queen and cheer the young princes and princess. But whilst Aegon and Viserys relished in the cheers of the crowds and the feasts and frolics put on at every castle to entertain the new monarch and his family, Princess Rhaena reverted to her former shyness. At Storm’s End, Orys Baratheon’s maester went so far as to write, “The princess did not seem to want to be there, nor did she approve of anything she saw or heard. She scarce seemed to eat, would not hunt or hawk, and when pressed to sing—for she is said to have a lovely voice—she refused rudely and returned to her chambers.” The princess had been most loath to be parted from her dragon, Dreamfyre, and her latest favorite, Melony Piper, a red-haired maiden from the riverlands. It was only when her mother, Queen Alyssa, sent for Lady Melony to join them on the progress that Rhaena finally put aside her sullenness to join the celebrations.
events: feasts and frolics put on at every castle
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Aegon, Viserys and Princess Rhaena, the new king and queen of Westeros, rode towards Storm's End accompanied by their entourage. A great cheer came from the smallfolk as they appeared on Quicksilver, an exceptionally beautiful horse gifted to them for their coronation. Orys Baratheon was mounted alongside them. Lady Melony had been sent for when Queen Alyssa refused rudely to join in the celebrating with the lords and ladies at Storm's End, having put aside her former shyness. Everywhere the royal court stopped during their arduous journey was filled with feasts and frolics put on in honor of their new monarchs who had received great fanfare from all corners of Westeros that day.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: At the Starry Sept, the High Septon anointed Aenys Targaryen as his predecessor had once anointed his father, and presented him with a crown of yellow gold with the faces of the Seven inlaid in jade and pearl. Yet even as Aenys was receiving the blessing of the Father of the Faithful, others were casting doubt on his fitness to sit the Iron Throne. Westeros required a warrior, they whispered to one another, and Maegor was plainly the stronger of the Dragon’s two sons. Foremost amongst the whisperers was the Dowager Queen Visenya Targaryen. “The truth is plain enough,” she is reported to have said. “Even Aenys sees it. Why else would he have given Blackfyre to my son? He knows that only Maegor has the strength to rule.”
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Dowager Queen Visenya Targaryen, accompanied by Ser Harys, Septon Pater, and many of House Tyrell's lords and ladies made their way to the Starry Sept for a grand ceremony. After High Septon Father of the Faithful had anointed Aenys Targaryen as the new King with a crown inlaid with yellow gold, jade and pearl whispered through crowds suggesting that such a blessing should not have been given so soon after Viserys refused rudely when sent for Lady Melony Piper from Rollingford to join in the celebrations at Storm's End . But despite all doubts, Aenys put aside his former shyness and reluctance, as he looked around him at the cheering smallfolk who welcomed him as their new monarch.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The new king’s mettle would be tested sooner than anyone could have imagined. The Wars of Conquest had left scars throughout the realm. Sons now come of age dreamed of avenging long-dead fathers. Knights remembered the days when a man with a sword and a horse and a suit of armor could slash his way to riches and glory. Lords recalled a time when they did not need a king’s leave to tax their smallfolk or kill their enemies. “The chains the Dragon forged can yet be broken,” the discontented told one another. “We can win our freedoms back, but now is the time to strike, for this new king is weak.”
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: As the castle gates opened and King Aenys Targaryen emerged from the Starry Sept, he was surrounded by a crowd of lords, knights, sons and other retainers. His entourage prepared to embark on his Wars of Conquest that would define him as one who forged an empire unlike anything ever imagined or avenged before it. The realm remembered the legacy left by Old Valyria and responded with adulation and cries for new glory firmly fixed on their lips. As he looked around at familiar faces- some strong, some handsome men- all willing to follow him into battle in service to their need to win, he remembered long-dead ancestors and those smallfolk whose faithfulness had only grown since his anointment. But this time was different —he could almost feel something more tangible in the air, like a promise reverberating through all in attendance that if they went forward together—their future would be new but marked with much higher stakes than any conqueror had ever set before…

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The first stirrings of revolt were in the riverlands, amidst the colossal ruins of Harrenhal. Aegon had granted the castle to Ser Quenton Qoherys, his old master-at-arms. When Lord Qoherys died in a fall from his horse in 9 AC, his title passed to his grandson Gargon, a fat and foolish man with an unseemly appetite for young girls who became known as Gargon the Guest. Lord Gargon soon became infamous for turning up at every wedding celebrated within his domains so that he might enjoy the lord’s right of the first night. A more unwelcome wedding guest can scarce be imagined. He also made free with the wives and daughters of his own servants.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Aegon, the Uncrowned King, rode into Harrenhal with his host of Knights, Lords and their Sons. He had remembered the Wars of Conquest vividly and wanted to avenge the smallfolk they had oppressed in that long-dead time. At Harrenhal he was granted possession over Gargon, who had become known as "the foolish fat Lord" for his unseemly and unwelcome ways. When Quenton Qoherys turned up at Harrenhal with news of stirrings of revolt, Aegon made free with supplies from House Tyrell and set off for Rollingford in the riverlands. Little did Monarch know that by this misfortunate fall from his horse in Riverrun, he would be ushering in an age where his House and faith are forged anew – finally giving them a chance to strike and win back what was so sorely needed.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: King Aenys was still on his progress, guesting with Lord Tully of Riverrun on his way back to King’s Landing, when the father of a maid whom Lord Qoherys had “honored” opened a postern gate at Harrenhal to an outlaw who styled himself Harren the Red and claimed to be a grandson of Harren the Black. The brigands pulled his lordship from his bed and dragged him to the castle godswood, where Harren sliced off his genitals and fed them to a dog. A few leal men-at- arms were killed; the rest agreed to join Harren, who declared himself Lord of Harrenhal and King of the Rivers (not being ironborn, he did not claim the islands).
events: opened a postern gate at Harrenhal
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: King Aenys, Lord Tully of Riverrun and Lord Qoherys soon arrived at the castle godswood with all of their entourage that included Harren the Red and Harren the Black who Guested together with them. As it so happened, King Aenys had opened up a postern gate at Harrenhal and almost exposed his army to danger. Fortunately, Lord Jon Lychester pulled him away just in time while Lord Ronnel Arryn declared him leal from all charges. What came next was unforgivable as Gargon dragged Quenton Qohreys away and sliced off his head to be fed to crows. It was then that Aegon had become known around Westeros for making free with unwise decisions thus gaining an unwelcome reputation for being foolish and fat.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: When word reached Riverrun, Lord Tully urged the king to mount Quicksilver and descend on Harrenhal as his father had. But His Grace, perhaps mindful of his mother’s death in Dorne, instead commanded Tully to summon his banners and lingered at Riverrun as they gathered. Only when a thousand men were assembled did Aenys march…but when his men reached Harrenhal, they found it empty but for corpses. Harren the Red had put Lord Gargon’s servants to the sword and taken his band into the woods.
events: summon his banners and lingered at Riverrun as they gathered.
march…but when his men reached Harrenhal, they found it empty but for corpses.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Lord Tully of Riverrun urged his Grace Aenys to summons his banners and lingered at Riverrun as they gathered. Soon, the outer gates of Harrenhal opened to a small but powerful force, led by Lord Gargon from Dorne. As commanded, the march for Harrenhal began..but when his men reached Harrenhal, they found it empty but for corpses. Every member of House Hightower had been put to death in such a way that echoed the Valyrian marriage customs - none taken alive and all taken by surprise. As tension rose through Westeros from this troubling event, mysterious rumors born from Samwell Tarly assigned blame on even more fantastical enemies's outside The Realm; across the narrow sea, to Tyrosh or perhaps Volantis came tales of Giants of The Trident hiring both handsome men and homely ones alike with gold dragons paying homage at their feet in some unholy union.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: By the time Aenys returned to King’s Landing the news had grown even worse. In the Vale, Lord Ronnel Arryn’s younger brother Jonos had deposed and imprisoned his loyal sibling, and declared himself King of Mountain and Vale. In the Iron Islands, another priest king had walked out of the sea, announcing himself to be Lodos the Twice- Drowned, the son of the Drowned God, returned at last from visiting his father. And high in the Red Mountains of Dorne, a pretender called the Vulture King appeared and called on all true Dornishmen to avenge the evils visited on Dorne by the Targaryens. Though Princess Deria denounced him, swearing that she and all leal Dornishmen wanted only peace, thousands flocked to his banners, swarming down from the hills and up out of the sands, through goat tracks in the mountains into the Reach.
events: dethroning and imprisoning Lord Ronnel Arryn’s younger brother Jonos by Jonos himself
The reappearance of Lodos the Twice-Drowned claiming to be the son of The Drowned God, returned from visiting his father
the rise of Vulture King which made thousands flock to his banners swarm down from hills and up out of the sands
verbs: called on all true Dornishmen to avenge evils visited on them by Targaryens, Princess denouncing him and swearing that she wanted only peace
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Aenys commanded Lord Ronnel Arryn to dethrone and imprison his younger brother Jonos. However, the lord's order was soon overshadowed by the reappearance of Lodos the Twice-Drowned claiming to be the son of The Drowned God, returned from visiting his father. Morale was lifted for those loyal to Lodos' claim as he called on all true Dornishmen to avenge the evils visited upon them by Targaryens. Princess Deria denounced him and swore that she wanted only peace in return. To make matters worse, news quickly spread throughout Westeros soft murmurs leading up to what would become known as "The Vulture King", which saw thousands flock to his banners swarm down from hills and up out of Red Mountains of Dorne and Reach towards King’s Landing.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: “This Vulture King is half-mad, and his followers are a rabble, undisciplined and unwashed,” Lord Harmon Dondarrion wrote to the king. “We can smell them coming fifty leagues away.” Not long after, that selfsame rabble stormed and seized his castle of Blackhaven. The Vulture King personally sliced off Dondarrion’s nose before putting Blackhaven to the torch and marching away.
events: stormed and seized his castle of Blackhaven
putting Blackhaven to the torch and marching away
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Vulture King and his rabble of half-mad, undisciplined and unwashed followers stormed and seized the castle of Blackhaven. When Lord Harmon Dondarrion spoke against him, Vulture King had sliced off his head while those who wrote in support of him had to face the smell of their burning homes as Vulture King put Blackhaven to the torch and marched away with a triumphal spirit. Meanwhile, word had spread across The Realm about the reappearance of Lodos the Twice-Drowned claiming he was sent by The Drowned God on a mission that called for justice for millennia old wrongs visited upon them by Targaryens. With Princess Deria denouncing him, news was carried even back to Westeros where everyone from kings to maesters cursed at its worst implications.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: King Aenys knew these rebels had to be put down, but seemed unable to decide where to begin. Grand Maester Gawen wrote that the king could not comprehend why this was happening. The smallfolk loved him, did they not? Jonos Arryn, this new Lodos, the Vulture King…had he wronged them? If they had grievances, why not bring them to him? “I would have heard them out.” His Grace spoke of sending messengers to the rebels, to learn the reasons for their actions. Fearing that King’s Landing might not be safe with Harren the Red alive and near, he sent Queen Alyssa and their younger children to Dragonstone. He commanded his Hand, Lord Alyn Stokeworth, to take a fleet and army to the Vale to put down Jonos Arryn and restore his brother Ronnel to the lordship. But when the ships were about to sail, he countermanded the order, fearing that Stokeworth’s departure would leave King’s Landing undefended. Instead he sent the Hand with but a few hundred men to hunt down Harren the Red, and decided he would summon a great council to discuss how best to put down the other rebels.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: When King Aenys put down the last of the rebels who had stormed and seized his castle of Blackhaven, he knew something had gone terribly wrong. Grand Maester Gawen confirmed this when he spoke with Lord Jonos Arryn and Lodos, The Vulture King - they had been wronged. The king sent out countermanded orders to hunt down the undisciplined rabble, half mad with fear and blood lust that had put Blackhaven to the torch and marched away. His Grace vowed to make things right by sending representatives from Dragonstone, The Vale, and even Kings Landing to speak directly to those smallfolk who now lived in terror of retribution from their former leaders such as Alyssa and Ronnel but especially from Harren the Red who were infamous for their cruelty.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Whilst the king prevaricated, his lords took to the field. Some acted on their own authority, others in concert with the Dowager Queen. In the Vale, Lord Allard Royce of Runestone assembled twoscore loyal bannermen and marched against the Eyrie, easily defeating the supporters of the self-styled King of Mountain and Vale. But when they demanded the release of their rightful lord, Jonos Arryn sent his brother to them through the Moon Door. Such was the sad end of Ronnel Arryn, who had flown thrice about the Giant’s Lance on dragonback.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: As King Allard Royce assembled his loyal twoscore bannermen, Lord Jonos Arryn, alongside Ronnel Arryn, prevaricated at Runestone instead of immediately heeding the king's orders to march against the Eyrie. After a demand was made for their release and knowing they were wronged by relation to those at the Vale, they spoke of sending another through the Moon Door in their stead. With barely a few words between them all in the midst of this chaos, Jonos knew what had to be done and sent his brother to fulfill it; comprehending that should any strikes against him be countermanded then his actions will have marked him as an outlaw intent on hunting down his own smallfolk.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The Eyrie was impregnable to any conventional assault, so “King” Jonos and his die-hard followers spat down defiance at the loyalists, and settled in for a siege…until Prince Maegor appeared in the sky above, astride Balerion. The Conqueror’s younger son had claimed a dragon at last: none other than the Black Dread, the greatest of them all.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: The siege of The Eyrie had been going on for months and tensions were high, as Lord Allard Royce seemed to have no intention of yielding. With him was his son, Jonos Arryn, who with Lord Ronnel Arryn at his side, spat fiercely at their opponents from behind the thick castle walls. While both sides had resorted to conventional methods of warfare in the beginning, it quickly grew more desperate as the die-hard loyalists under King Maegor refused to budge an inch - despite having suffered grievous losses. When finally settled upon by all parties involved, Jonos’s victory was claimed a greatest amongst those assembled beneath Runestone and marched against the Vale; twoscore loyal bannermen flew beneath his own eagles even still.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Rather than face Balerion’s fires, the Eyrie’s garrison seized the pretender and delivered him to Lord Royce, opening the Moon Door once again and serving Jonos the kinslayer as he had served his brother. Surrender saved the pretender’s followers from burning, but not from death. After taking possession of the Eyrie, Prince Maegor executed them to a man. Even the highest born amongst them were denied the honor of dying by sword; traitors deserved only a rope, Maegor decreed, so the captured knights were hanged naked from the walls of the Eyrie, kicking as they strangled slowly. Hubert Arryn, a cousin to the dead brothers, was installed as Lord of the Vale. As he had already sired six sons by his lady wife, a Royce of Runestone, the Arryn succession was seen to be secure.
verbs: denied the honor of dying by sword, were hanged naked from the walls of the Eyrie, strangled slowly, installed
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Prince Maegor Targaryen had succeeded in his siege of the Eyrie, causing Jonos and House Arryn to surrender after the spat was settled. After Lord Royce delivered Balerion to the Moon Door, opened it, and served as a witness while Prince Maegor took possession of the castle, those who denied him the honor of dying by sword were hanged naked from walls of The Eyrie. Hubert Arryn took control as pretender to provide a sense of peace and stability; it seemed that Ser Harys' plea for a conventional die-hard fighter had been answered. Little did they know, however, that this would be one of Maegor's greatest deeds and mark one turning point in Westerosi history.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: In the Iron Islands, Goren Greyjoy, Lord Reaper of Pyke, brought “King” Lodos (Second of That Name) to a similar swift end, marshalling a hundred longships to descend on Old Wyk and Great Wyk, where the pretender’s followers were most numerous, and putting thousands of them to the sword. Afterward he had the head of the priest king pickled in brine and sent to King’s Landing. King Aenys was so pleased by the gift that he offered Greyjoy any boon he might desire. This proved unwise. Lord Goren, wishing to prove himself a true son of the Drowned God, asked the king for the right to expell all the septons and septas who had come to the Iron Islands after the Conquest to convert the ironborn to the worship of the Seven. King Aenys had no choice but to agree.
events: Lord Goren offered a boin to King Aenys in return for expelling all the septons and septas from the Iron Islands
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: When Lord Goren Greyjoy offered a boin to King Aenys in return for expelling all the septons and septas from the Iron Islands, there was a similar swift agreement. In no time thousands of pious lords were marshalling within Old Wyk, sending ships towards Great Wyk and descend southwards asking for aid. This offered an opportunity for people like Ser Harys Horpe who descended on Kings Landing with his entourage bringing Septon Pater from House Tyrell of Rollingford, Princess Deria Martell, her son Lord Father, members of Kingsguard as well as Aegon I‘s trusted followers like Lord Buckwell and even some devotees of the Drowned God while they denied the honor of dying by sword. All those who pledged their allegiance to the pretender were hanged naked from walls at the Eyrie or strangled slowly and installed where appropriate - offering those like Hubert Arryn a chance at being saved one more time.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The largest and most threatening rebellion remained that of the Vulture King along the Dornish Marches. Though Princess Deria continued to issue denunciations from Sunspear, there were many who suspected that she was playing a double game, for she did not take the field against the rebels and was rumored to be sending them men, money, and supplies. Whether that was true or not, hundreds of Dornish knights and several thousand seasoned spearmen had joined the Vulture King’s rabble, and the rabble itself had swelled enormously, to more than thirty thousand men. So large had his host become that the Vulture King made an ill-considered decision and divided his strength. Whilst he marched west against Nightsong and Horn Hill with half the Dornish power, the other half went east to besiege Stonehelm, seat of House Swann, under the command of Lord Walter Wyl, the son of the Widow-lover.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Princess Deria, daughter of Lord Walter Wyl and the Vulture King from Sunspear, found a strong support in the rebellion against Iron Islands rule when thousands of young men from across the Realm joined her. With them swelling their numbers, from Westermen and Riverlords to Old Valyrians, they marched towards Nightsong to besiege one of the largest holdings of King Aenys' forces threatening to double-game him. The seasoned military force was enormously larger than anything Lord Goren Greyjoy had sent before; even so, by sending such an enormous force so swift after offering a boin to King Aenys - asking him in similar terms to expel all the septons and septas from the Iron Islands - Princess Deria might have caused an issue of marshalling lords loyal to House Tyrell that remained divided.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Both hosts met with disaster. Orys Baratheon, known now as Orys One-Hand, rode forth from Storm’s End one last time, to smash the Dornish beneath the walls of Stonehelm. When Walter Wyl was delivered into his hands, wounded but alive, Lord Orys said, “Your father took my hand. I claim yours as repayment.” So saying, he hacked off Lord Walter’s sword hand. Then he took his other hand and both his feet as well, calling them his “usury.” Strange to say, Lord Baratheon died on the march back to Storm’s End, of the wounds he himself had taken during the battle, but his son Davos always said he died content, smiling at the rotting hands and feet that dangled in his tent like a string of onions.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Orys Baratheon and Orys One-Hand had met with Lord Walter Wyl at Storm’s End, and after riding forth, they smashed through Stonehelm in an effort to take control of the symbolically important location. They took it and claimed leadership over it even as the Vulture King marched towards Nightsong, threatening to besiege one of the largest cities in the Kingdom. As their rebellion had joined forces during this momentous event, support for their cause swelled enormously - eventually dividing people into two camps who faced off at what became known as The Last Rebellion. Despite his veteran status in battle experience, Walter Wyl was not ready for what ensued that day; but Davos Seaworth remained hopeful that something could be salvaged from the situation in order to eliminate any further consequences.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The Vulture King himself fared little better. Unable to capture Nightsong, he abandoned the siege and marched west, only to have Lady Caron sally forth behind him, to join up with a strong force of marchers led by Harmon Dondarrion, the mutilated Lord of Blackhaven. Meanwhile Lord Samwell Tarly of Horn Hill suddenly appeared athwart the Dornish line of march with several thousand knights and archers. Savage Sam, that lord was called, and so he proved in the bloody battle that ensued, cutting down dozens of Dornishmen with his great Valyrian steel blade Heartsbane. The Vulture King had twice as many men as his three foes combined, but most were untrained and undisciplined, and when faced with armored knights at front and rear, their ranks shattered. Throwing down their spears and shields, the Dornish broke and ran, making for the distant mountains, but the marcher lords rode after them and cut them down, in what became known after as “the Vulture Hunt.”
characters: Lord Samwell Tarly of Horn Hill
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: The Vulture King had laid siege to Blackhaven for many weeks now and rumors of his plan had spread amid the citizens of Horn Hill. As he began to march outward from Blackhaven, Lord Samwell Tarly of Horn Hill rode forth with a strong force eager to crush the enemy's power and rescue Lady Caron from the besieged castle. A battle ensued, and despite throwing everything at each other no side gained an advantage in what seemed like an everlasting conflict. That is, until Savage Sam Tarly appeared at the very front of the battlefield brandishing a great Valyrian steel blade; their fate was sealed as every last man loyal to The Vulture King broke away and abandoned the fight upon seeing him, never to seem again. He had single handedly delivered them victory! Justice was served after such a long struggle.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: As for the rebel king himself, the man who called himself the Vulture King was taken alive and tied naked between two posts by Savage Sam Tarly. The singers like to say that he was torn to pieces by the very vultures from whom he took his style, but in truth he perished of thirst and exposure, and the birds did not descend on him until well after he was dead. (In later years, several other men would take the title Vulture King, but whether they were of the same blood as the first, no man can say.) His death is generally accounted as the end of the Second Dornish War, though that is somewhat of a misnomer, since no Dornish lords ever took the field, and Princess Deria continued to vilify the Vulture King until his end and took no part in his campaigns.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: The Second Dornish War was called upon when the Vulture King and Savage Sam Tarly descended on Horn Hill, intent on taking it for revenge. The fierce battle that ensued saw many perish and others tied or even torn apart by troops of the Second Dornish War. However, Princess Deria Martell was one such lucky soul to be accounted a rebel force and managed to barely escape naked from the strong force that had appeared out of nowhere, throwing them back in disarray. Even after all this, what still remains unclear is the outcome of this latest march against the Vulture King's forces.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The first of the rebels proved to be the last as well, but Harren the Red was at last brought to bay in a village west of the Gods Eye. The outlaw king did not die meekly. In his last fight, he slew the King’s Hand, Lord Alyn Stokeworth, before being cut down by Stokeworth’s squire, Bernarr Brune. A grateful King Aenys conferred knighthood on Brune, and rewarded Davos Baratheon, Samwell Tarly, No-Nose Dondarrion, Ellyn Caron, Allard Royce, and Goren Greyjoy with gold, offices, and honors. The greatest plaudits he bestowed on his own brother. On his return to King’s Landing, Prince Maegor was hailed as a hero. King Aenys embraced him before a cheering throng, and named him Hand of the King. And when two young dragons hatched amidst the firepits of Dragonstone at the end of that year, it was taken for a sign.
places: Village West of the Gods Eye
events: Harren the Red Brought to Bay in a Village West of the Gods Eye
Slew the King's Hand, Lord Alyn Stokeworth,
