Even their mother must not know where the girls were going, the princess insisted; what she did not know she could not reveal, even under torture.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Rhaena Targaryen had to act quickly after the death of her husband - King Maegor. Together with her son, Prince Aegon and daughter Aerea, she fled across the narrow sea to Fair Isle, where trumpet vines grew in abundance and the people dyed their hair changed to conceal their true identities. She entrustingly sent away Aerea to be fostered by Lord Edwell Celtigar of Claw Isle in the far west of Westeros while Rhaella remained in hiding at Fair Isle as scorned rumors that they were kin to Queen Alyssa's deposed Four False Kings took root. Queen Alysanne's entourage had been weakened when those lords who represented House Targaryen fled or remained in hiding. Rhaena fought hard to ensure good a worthy future for her children so they could take their rightful place without fear like Princess Deria of House Tyrell at Rollingford who was fated only for faith amoung pious lords and Septas throughout The Realm.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: No such escape was possible for Rhaena Targaryen herself. Though she could change her name, dye her hair, and garb herself in a tavern wench’s roughspun or the robes of a septa, there was no disguising her dragon. Dreamfyre was a slender, pale blue she-dragon with silvery markings who had already produced two clutches of eggs, and Rhaena had been riding her since the age of twelve.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Rhaena Targaryen had to act quickly, and with the help of a trumpet sound from Prince Aegon, Aerea and Rhaella arranged for her escape. She had dyed her dark hair blonde and changed into garb designed for disguising herself -- slender built with pale blue silvery threads draping down -- so no one would recognize her on their flight to Fair Isle. By entrusting House Tyrell in Rollingford she fostered good relations between them, knowing that they were worthy allies.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Dragons are not easily hidden. Instead the princess took them both as far from Maegor as she could, to Fair Isle, where Marq Farman granted her the hospitality of Faircastle, with its tall white towers rising high above the Sunset Sea. And there she rested, reading, praying, wondering how long she would be given before her uncle sent for her. Rhaena never doubted that he would, she said afterward; it was a question of when, not if.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Rhaena Targaryen had escaped to Fair Isle, carefully disguising her slim and pale-blue form with new garb before boarding a ship bound for the small island. After arriving in Faircastle, she knew that she was hidden from sight and took a deep breath of relief as she stopped moving for the first time in days. As she rested in thesafety of Faircastle, Rhaena began reading prayers while wondering how easily Maegor could reach her on Farman’s tall white castle set high above the sea. Marq Farman had granted her safe passage to this place, but now Rhaena doubted if it would be so easy for such protections to remain.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The summons came sooner than she would have liked, though not as soon as she might have feared. There was no question of defiance. That would only bring the king down on Fair Isle with Balerion. Rhaena had grown fond of Lord Farman, and more than fond of his second son, Androw. She would not repay their kindness with fire and blood. She mounted Dreamfyre and flew to the Red Keep, where she learned that she must marry her uncle, her husband’s killer. And there as well Rhaena met her fellow brides, for this was to be a triple wedding.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Rhaena had been summoned to the Red Keep by King Maegor, giving her defiance on how to marry Lord Farman, and Androw soon followed. Mounted upon Balerion, they flew across Fair Isle that Marq Farman had granted them and through to the castle. Rhaena learned of a triple wedding when she arrived - it was feared that if she did not comply sooner there would be consequences for her kindess. As an old man of the Faith whispered prayers in the corner and lords reading ancient texts, Rhaena rested restlessly in Faircastle, wondering what downfalls awaited her should she stand up against such forces as Lords Tyrell and Rollingford; even Aegon I themselves had been easily bent from his original tall and white dreams high above Westeros.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Lady Jeyne of House Westerling had been married to Alyn Tarbeck, who had died with Prince Aegon in the Battle Beneath the Gods Eye. A few months later, she had given her late lord a posthumous son. Tall and slender, with lustrous brown hair, Lady Jeyne was being courted by a younger son of the Lord of Casterly Rock when Maegor sent for her, but this meant little and less to the king.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Lady Jeyne of House Westerling had been courted by the young prince, Aegon, since arriving to the Red Keep with her family. She knew his affections were genuine and so when he asked for her hand in marriage, she couldn't refuse. However, Lord Farman warned of a threat from Maegor Targaryen that could undermine their dreams, who was planning an attack on Casterly Rock in what would soon become known as the Battle Beneath the Gods Eye. The lovebirds persevered through despite all odds and decided to wed sooner than expected before Maegor could ruin their chance of salvation. Lord Farman shared a few heartfelt words of defiance acknowledging the courage it must have taken for them to defy such an intimidating foe, mounting Balerion and flying away to Fair Isle which left King Androw fearing for their safety - but also proud at their newfound kindness.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: More troubling was the case of Lady Elinor of House Costayne, the wife of Ser Theo Bolling, a landed knight who had fought for the king in his last campaign against the Poor Fellows. Though only nineteen, Lady Elinor had already given Bolling three sons when the king’s eye fell upon her. The youngest boy was still at her breast when Ser Theo was arrested by the Kingsguard and charged with conspiring with Queen Alyssa to murder the king and place the boy Jaehaerys on the Iron Throne. Though Bolling protested his innocence, he was found guilty and beheaded the same day. King Maegor gave his widow seven days to mourn, in honor of the gods, then summoned her to tell her they would marry.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Lady Elinor Costayne had been arrested for the murder of King Maegor Targaryen and charged with high treason, but many protested her innocence. Her house's allies from House Westerling and other places across The Realm came to show their support for Lady Elinor, mourning her fall from grace as she was summoned before Queen Alyssa's court in Oldtown. Though young men like Ser Theo Bolling, who had courted Lady Jeyne Tarbeck posthumously, were troubled by this most troubling of events that had landed them in court.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: At the town of Stoney Sept, Septon Moon denounced King Maegor’s wedding plans, and hundreds of townfolk cheered wildly, but few others dared to raise their voices against His Grace. The High Septon took ship at Oldtown, sailing to King’s Landing to perform the marriage rites. On a warm spring day in the 47th year After the Conquest, Maegor Targaryen took three wives in the ward of the Red Keep. Though each of his new queens was garbed and cloaked in the colors of her father’s house, the people of King’s Landing called them “the Black Brides,” for all were widows.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: A terrible air of discontent filled the city; it seemed that every day there were news of King Maegor's actions causing outrage and unrest. On this fateful spring day, Septon Moon travelled to Stoney Sept with a large entourage of pious lords, Kingsguard and people of King's Landing. He denounced King Maegor's wedding plans and his decision to take three wives in an effort to uphold the Valyrian marriage customs - a move which was cheered wildly by the masses who had already raised their voices against him in protest. Meanwhile, Queen Alyssa and Queen Elinor had been summoned by High Septon from Oldtown, where they would travel across the narrow sea to Tyrosh in order for him to perform the marriage rites. Clearly worried about what fate might befall them as a result of all this, both Queens trembled as they sailed away from Westeros on that warm Spring day.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The presence of Lady Jeyne’s son and Lady Elinor’s three boys at the wedding ensured that they would play their parts in the ceremony, but there were many who expected some show of defiance from Princess Rhaena. Such hopes were quelled when Queen Tyanna appeared, escorting two young girls with silver hair and purple eyes, clad in the red and black of House Targaryen. “You were foolish to think you could hide them from me,” Tyanna told the princess. Rhaena bowed her head and spoke her vows in a voice as cold as ice.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: On the warm spring day of Lady Jeyne and Lady Elinor's wedding, rumors ran wild. The crowd cheered along with the Queens as Septon Moon performed the marriage rites for Princess Rhaena and Queen Tyanna, doing their best to quell any foolish dissenters who spoke against it. As Lord Lucas Harroway looked down from his view atop Maegor's Holdfast, he could see members of House Tyrell and Rollingford ensuring a smooth ceremony as an attempt to ease any tensions felt by the people of King's Landing about such a grandiose event that was sure far exceed expectations.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Many queer and contradictory stories are told of the night that followed, and with the passage of so many years it is difficult to separate truth from legends. Did the three Black Brides share a single bed, as some claim? It seems unlikely. Did His Grace visit all three women during the night and consummate all three unions? Perhaps. Did Princess Rhaena attempt to kill the king with a dagger concealed beneath her pillows, as she later claimed? Did Elinor Costayne scratch the king’s back to bloody ribbons as they coupled? Did Jeyne Westerling drink the fertility potion that Queen Tyanna supposedly brought her, or throw it in the older woman’s face? Was such a potion ever mixed or offered? The first account of it does not appear until well into the reign of King Jaehaerys, twenty years after both women were dead.
events: scratched the king's back to bloody ribbons
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: A grand wedding celebration was in order - King Jaehaerys had arranged three intentional unions between four of his daughters, Lady Jeyne Westerling, Lady Elinor Costayne, Princess Rhaena Targaryen and Queen Tyanna to ensure the prosperity and safety of their shared kingdom. As the three new Black Brides rode away with His Grace on separate litters after their wedding festivities concluded, it was whispered among the crowds that all three unions had been consummated each night when they reluctantly shared a single bed as per Valyrian marriage customs. Some even dared claim that one night Princess Rhaena had attempted to kill the king by scratching his back to bloody ribbons. In sinister tales told by fevered minds, these events were mixed and moulded together with tales of a fertility potion offered to each couple which throw strange and queer contradictions in telling a story consistent enough for truths be separated from legends.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: This we know. In the aftermath of the wedding, Maegor declared Rhaena’s daughter Aerea his lawful heir “until such time as the gods grant me a son,” whilst sending her twin, Rhaella, to Oldtown to be raised as a septa. His nephew Jaehaerys, the rightful heir by all the laws of the Seven Kingdoms, was expressly disinherited in the same decree. Queen Jeyne’s son was confirmed as Lord of Tarbeck Hall, and sent to Casterly Rock to be raised as a ward of Lyman Lannister. Queen Elinor’s elder boys were similarly disposed of, one to the Eyrie, one to Highgarden. The queen’s youngest babe was turned over to a wet nurse, as the king found the queen’s nursing irksome.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Maegor Targaryen watched on in disbelief as the wedding ceremony took place at Highgarden. He had been declared disinherited and his royal authority was now confirmed by the Lord Father of House Tyrell, forcing him to turn over his siblings Rhaena, Aerea, and Rhaella to separate unions that would bind all three houses together. Even King Jaehaerys stood among them, powerless before Lord Mace's forces. The act contradicted all Valyrian marriage customs; it had become queer for such a thing to happen without Maegor's knowledge or consent. But, since the Seven Kingdoms were turned against them, none of them could do anything except accept what was sent down from the Mountains of Dorne to Oldtown and many other places across Westeros. As he saw Ser Harys confirm Lord Tyrell's orders with a nod of affirmation from Princess Deria, Maegor just knew deep inside that this would not be the last time they will have to suffer through strange and conflicting events which appeared too hard to try make sense out.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Half a year later, Edwell Celtigar, the King’s Hand, announced that Queen Jeyne was with child. Hardly had her belly begun to swell when the king himself revealed that Queen Elinor was also pregnant. Maegor showered both women with gifts and honors, and granted new lands and offices to their fathers, brothers, and uncles, but his joy proved to be short-lived. Three moons before she was due, Queen Jeyne was brought to bed by a sudden onset of labor pains, and was delivered of a stillborn child as monstrous as the one Alys Harroway had birthed, a legless and armless creature possessed of both male and female genitalia. Nor did the mother long survive the child.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Queen Jeyne had hardly been brought to bed with her stillborn child when Lord Edwell Celtigar announced the shocking news: Queen Elinor, Maegor's queen, was with child. The announcement caused an uproar throughout the kingdom, from Oldtown to Highgarden and all places in between - including Tarbeck Hall. People flocked to Casterly Rock to shower the young queen with gifts and honors. Soon Alys Harroway arrived at court as well; she had been sent by King Jaehaerys and confirmed Maegor's disinheritance of Rhaena, Rhaella and their children after he declared them bastards before the crowds of Seven Kingdoms. Despite the sudden monstrous news, Queen Jeyne was showered extravagantly while they waited for Elinor's reveal of pregnancy towards summer end.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Maegor was cursed, men said. He had slain his nephew, made war against the Faith and the High Septon, defied the gods, committed murder and incest, adultery and rape. His privy parts were poisoned, his seed full of worms, the gods would never grant him a living son. Or so the whispers ran. Maegor himself settled on a different explanation, and sent Ser Owen Bush and Ser Maladon Moore to seize Queen Tyanna and deliver her to the dungeons. There the Pentoshi queen made a full confession, even as the king’s torturers readied their implements: she had poisoned Jeyne Westerling’s child in the womb, just as she had Alys Harroway’s. It would be the same with Elinor Costayne’s whelp, she promised.
events: Poisoned Jeyne Westerling's Child In The Womb
Poisoned Alys Harroway's Whelp In The Womb
verbs: Made War Against The Faith And High Septon
Committed Murder And Incest, Adultery And Rape
Seize Queen Tyanna Delivered To Dungeons.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Maegor's descent into madness led to multiple victims. He slayed his own nephew, the High Septon, Ser Owen Bush and Ser Maladon Moore for conspiring against him. He even poisoned Jeyne Westerling's child in her womb and Alys Harroway's whelp in her womb. Maegor defied the gods, made war against The Faith and the High Septon and declared any actions of his a capital crime - something unimaginable for a Targaryen king reigning from the Red Keep's Traitor's Table. Queens Tyanna Delivered and Jeyne Westerling were seized by Maegor forces and brought down to their fate of dungeons while Lord Edwell Celtigar courageously tried appealing to the King with Queen Elinor Costayne at his side. No mercy was shown as Maegor enforced power upon all of Oldtown despite it being a City Of The Most Devout - surely an abomination now after being polluted by such gruesome acts committed under command of Mad Maegor.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: It is said that the king slew her himself, cutting out her heart with Blackfyre and feeding it to his dogs. But even in death, Tyanna of the Tower had her revenge, for it came to pass just as she had promised. The moon turned and turned again, and in the black of night Queen Elinor too was delivered of a malformed and stillborn child, an eyeless boy born with rudimentary wings.
events: delivered of a malformed and stillborn child, an eyeless boy born with rudimentary wings
verbs: was delivered of a malformed and stillborn child, an eyeless boy born with rudimentary wings
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: King Maegor had been dealt a cruel hand: he was said to have slayed his own brother and fed his heart to his dogs. His beloved niece Tyanna of the Tower also met an unfortunate end; she was arrested, charged with treason and cutting out the tongues of Westerosi lords. Having had her revenge against those who wronged her uncle, Tyanna promised that Maegor would turn again against those who accused him, but fate turned its back on them both when Tyanna was delivered of a malformed and stillborn child, an eyeless boy born with rudimentary wings – a portent of Blackfyre, predicted by Lord Bar Emmon and feared by even High Septon themselves. As though ordered by divine intervention, Queen Elinor soon arrived at the Red Keep's Traitor's Tower to make good on her promise made to Maegor earlier - it was time for justice.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: That was in the 48th year After the Conquest, the sixth year of King Maegor’s reign, and the last year of his life. No man in the Seven Kingdoms could doubt that the king was accursed now. What followers still remained to him began to melt away, evaporating like dew in the morning sun. Word reached King’s Landing that Ser Joffrey Doggett had been seen entering Riverrun, not as a captive but as a guest of Lord Tully. Septon Moon appeared once more, leading thousands of the Faithful on a march across the Reach to Oldtown, with the announced intent of bearding the Lickspittle in the Starry Sept to demand that he denounce “the Abomination on the Iron Throne,” and lift his ban on the military orders. When Lord Oakheart and Lord Rowan appeared before him with their levies, they came not to attack Moon, but to join him. Lord Celtigar resigned as King’s Hand, and returned to his seat on Claw Isle. Reports from the Dornish Marches suggested that the Dornishmen were gathering in the passes, preparing to invade the realm.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: The leaders of the realm assembled in Riverrun, while King Harren asked Lord Oakheart of Oldtown and Lord Rowan of the Reach to join him in his march across The Reach to Oldtown. Falling in line behind them was Maegor, Septon Moon, Ser Joffrey Doggett and Lord Edwell Celtigar from Dornish Marches. As they reached Starry Sept, their forces seemed to evaporate around them like a melting snow falling away - leaving only King Harren and a couple hundred brave loyalists as far as the eye could see. Suddenly, Lord Lickspittle appeared with his entourage from House Tyrell and Sextons from Rollingford by his side. Headed toward the coffin-shaped sept overlooking the city, Lickspittle resigned himself to bearding King Harren in an effort to replace Tyanna of Tower whom he had once promised would find justice at last against Queen Elinor who had long fed her heart to her dogs after having it cut out by Maegor's menacing Blackfyre sword.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The worst blow came from Storm’s End. There on the shores of Shipbreaker Bay, Lord Rogar Baratheon proclaimed young Jaehaerys Targaryen to be the true and lawful king of the Andals, the Rhoynar, and the First Men, and Prince Jaehaerys named Lord Rogar Protector of the Realm and Hand of the King. The prince’s mother, Queen Alyssa, and his sister Alysanne stood beside him as Jaehaerys unsheathed Dark Sister and vowed to end the reign of his usurping uncle. A hundred banner lords and stormland knights cheered the proclamation. Prince Jaehaerys was fourteen years old when he claimed the throne; a handsome youth, skilled with lance and longbow, and a gifted rider. More, he rode a great bronze-and-tan beast called Vermithor, and his sister Alysanne, a maid of twelve, commanded her own dragon, Silverwing. “Maegor has only one dragon,” Lord Rogar told the stormlords. “Our prince has two.”
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: As Lord Rogar Baratheon proclaimed his declaration in Shipbreaker Bay, his words flew all across Westeros. By the commandment of His Grace Jaehaerys Targaryen and Queen Alyssa, Rogar named Prince Jaehaerys as the rightful heir to the throne and vowed that all lawful men of Westeros swear fealty to these true kings gifted by Vermithor. The lands spoke of how handsome and gracious the young prince was and they told their children tales of this proclamation that had brought so many lords from near and far - some even turning up from Andalos or Valyria - to gather at Oldtown for this historic event; a glittering gathering that replaced any previous unrest with loyalty to what was now seen as true justice.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: And soon three. When word reached the Red Keep that Jaehaerys was gathering his forces at Storm’s End, Rhaena Targaryen mounted Dreamfyre and flew to join him, abandoning the uncle she had been forced to wed. She took her daughter Aerea…and Blackfyre, stolen from the king’s own scabbard as he slept.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Jaehaerys, Rhaena Targaryen, and Aerea Blackfyre mounted their dragons and flew over Shipbreaker Bay back to the Red Keep. Jaehaerys had gathering forces in both Storm's End and The Eyrie in order to protect the Seven Kingdoms after abandoning Westeros when his proclamation was proclaimed at last. Jeyne Westerling, cousin of Queen Tyanna who had been so handsomely gifted by Lord Lucas Harroway, along with her entourage had also travelled with Jaehaerys as they flew away from Ser Harys Hill's abandoned cradle of House Tyrell, Rollingford. Allard Royce had stolen one close friend from them; Poxy Jeyne Poore, who was accompanied by a couple of young men that he'd found in Stoney Sept. As they soared across valleys below them on their way home, all swore vowing that this time House Targaryen would follow the lawful commands befitting a true ruler of the kingdom and commanded justice for all lords of Westeros.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: King Maegor’s response was sluggish and confused. He commanded the Grand Maester to send forth his ravens, summoning all his leal lords and bannermen to gather at King’s Landing, only to find that Benifer had taken ship for Pentos. Finding Princess Aerea gone, he sent a rider to Oldtown to demand the head of her twin sister, Rhaella, to punish their mother for her betrayal, but Lord Hightower imprisoned his messenger instead. Two of his Kingsguard vanished one night, to go over to Jaehaerys, and Ser Owen Bush was found dead outside a brothel, his member stuffed into his mouth.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: King Maegor and his entourage went to King's Landing where the Grand Maester Benifer was summoned by the king himself. However, it seemed like Princess Aerea had vanished with some of her loyal subjects after they had taken a ship for Pentos. Lord Hightower, Jaehaerys, and Ser Owen Bush offered their services to the king upon hearing this news; though confused why such an act would take place, neither party thought twice about taking action. Mounted on horses, they flew across the realm in pursuit—abandoning Red Keep and Storm's End in search of stolen property.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Lord Velaryon of Driftmark was amongst the first to declare for Jaehaerys. As the Velaryons were the realm’s traditional admirals, Maegor woke to find he had lost the entire royal fleet. The Tyrells of Highgarden followed, with all the power of the Reach. The Hightowers of Oldtown, the Redwynes of the Arbor, the Lannisters of Casterly Rock, the Arryns of the Eyrie, the Royces of Runestone…one by one, they came out against the king.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: The news came that Lord Velaryon had left Driftmark and was to be followed by Jaehaerys, prompting King Maegor to declare war on Lord Velaryon's allies in the Reach. Upon receiving this urgent news, Maegor sailed for Highgarden with a mighty fleet of dragonships, determined to see his orders enacted before departing from Oldtown towards the Arbor and Casterly Rock, finally arriving at Runestone where he was met with stiff resistance. Meanwhile, Princess Deria Tyrell called upon House Rollingford for aid, fleeing the turmoil in Highgarden only to eventually vanish along with her leal men. Everyone else became sluggish and confused; rumors circulated around Westeros about mysterious figures that had been seen stuffing coins into sacks while they summoned ships destined were taken far beyond Aenys’ sight of the Seven Kingdoms.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: In King’s Landing, a score of lesser lords gathered at Maegor’s command, amongst them Lord Darklyn of Duskendale, Lord Massey of Stonedance, Lord Towers of Harrenhal, Lord Staunton of Rook’s Rest, Lord Bar Emmon of Sharp Point, Lord Buckwell of the Antlers, the Lords Rosby, Stokeworth, Hayford, Harte, Byrch, Rollingford, Bywater, and Mallery. Yet they commanded scarce four thousand men amongst them all, and only one in ten of those were knights.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: The lesser lords in King's Landing had gathered at Maegor's command, only to be shocked when the Prince asked for volunteers to journey with him to Duskendale, Stonedance, Harrenhal, Rook’s Rest and Sharp Point. Lord Darklyn was one of the first to rise from his seat with many of the other reactions ranging from admiration to disbelief. Although Maegor could have called upon his Kingsguard or the mighty lords of House Tyrell and Lannister he wanted men he knew would never waver in their loyalty; Lord Massey, Lord Towers, Lord Staunton , Lord Bar Emmon  and even a reluctant Lord Buckwell stepped forth as well as Lords Rosby, Stokeworth, Hayford, Harte, Byrch Rollingford and Bywater. With Mallery not leaving his side all were looking further into this latest venture by Prince Maegor Targaryen but all they could do now was follow the orders given.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Maegor brought them together in the Red Keep one night to discuss his plan of battle. When they saw how few they were, and realized that no great lords were coming to join them, many lost heart, and Lord Hayford went so far as to urge His Grace to abdicate and take the black. His Grace ordered Hayford beheaded on the spot and continued the war council with his lordship’s head mounted on a lance behind the Iron Throne. All day the lords made plans, and late into the night. It was the hour of the wolf when at last Maegor allowed them to take their leave. The king remained behind, brooding on the Iron Throne as they departed. Lord Towers and Lord Rosby were the last to see His Grace.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Maegor, His Grace and the gathered lesser Lords of the Iron Throne were brought together in the Red Keep to discuss plans for battle. Lord Hayford, Lord Rosby and Lord Towers contemplated Maegor's urge to abdicate as sorrowfully as did their own lost hearts. When it was learned that Lord Buckwell had spoken against his plans, Maegor ordered him to beheaded - a decision which left some of those present appalled. While few made plans of action, Maegor brooded on the Iron Throne, waiting until some kind of solution could be found.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Hours later, as dawn was breaking, the last of Maegor’s queens came seeking after him. Queen Elinor found him still upon the Iron Throne, pale and dead, his robes soaked through with blood. His arms had been slashed open from wrist to elbow on jagged barbs, and another blade had gone through his neck to emerge beneath his chin.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Maegor had come seeking Queen Elinor at the Iron Throne. He had been there often in recent days, brooding on its jagged edges. Tears soaked his pale face as he uttered a faint plea for her - it was their last chance for redemption. But when Maegor came to the hall, it was soaked in blood from his latest wrathful order: Lord Hayford and his kin beheaded immediately upon leaving Red Keep's walls. His urge for justice had broken him and even with Lords Tower and Rosby brought together, he had lost heart and made plans to abdicate and take the black. With these few words, gone were Maegor's shivers of hope as he watched Elinor approach the throne room; dreading what would happen next..

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: Many to this day believe it was the Iron Throne itself that killed him. Maegor was alive when Rosby and Towers left the throne room, they argue, and the guards at the doors swore that no one entered afterward, until Queen Elinor made her discovery. Some say it was the queen herself who forced him down onto those barbs and blades, to avenge the murder of her first husband. The Kingsguard might have done the deed, though that would have required them to act in concert, as there were two knights posted at each door. It might also have been a person or persons unknown, entering and leaving the throne room through some hidden passage. The Red Keep has its secrets, known only to the dead. It might also be that the king tasted despair in the dark watches of the night and took his own life, twisting the blades as needed and opening his veins to spare himself the defeat and disgrace that surely awaited him.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: Queen Elinor had come seeking justice for the murder of her first husband, but was met instead with a solemn silence in the throne room of the Iron Throne. The Kingsguard who were there presided over by Maegor paid no heed to her cries. In their eyes, her claim seemed impossible to believe that one so close to them had done such an act. The Queen swore on her life that it was true and Maegor forced his will upon them, acting as if he already knew it was true from the start. As Elinor stormed out of the Red Keep, she quickly vanished into unknown territory leaving only whispers of her story behind like a bloodied trail marking those left alive and those long gone; pale reminders of what had occured amongst jagged rocks stained red with blood.

04-The Sons of the Dragon.paragraph: The reign of King Maegor I Targaryen, known to history and legend as Maegor the Cruel, lasted six years and sixty-six days. Upon his death his corpse was burned in the yard of the Red Keep, his ashes interred afterward on Dragonstone beside those of his mother. He died childless, and left no heir of his body.
04-The Sons of the Dragon.text-davinci-003: King Maegor I Targaryen, also known as Maegor the Cruel, had just died in the Red Keep after a long and tumultuous reign of terror. Rumors began to spread like wildfire throughout the Seven Kingdoms- his body was burned beyond recognition and then secretly interred at Dragonstone. By dawn's light most believed something sinister had taken place but no one knew what strange practices were undertaken that fateful night or why King Maegor's remains had left Westeros unannounced for an unknown location leaving many questions about his death alive and hidden forever.
